(10:57:49) Taz: I am planning to get rid of verbose nonverbose option (10:57:58) Taz: after all indexer is kind of daemon (10:57:59) Knut Anders Hatlen: yes please! :) (10:58:07) Taz: logging can take care of all our probs (10:58:31) Knut Anders Hatlen: or, verbose/nonverbose could still be there, only it controls the console logging level? (10:58:32) Taz: I just need to figure out how to say that all logs go to which file, but I hope logging has some function for it (10:59:08) Taz: yes, that is an option too ... but if you look at logging properties, you can just make all stuff go to log and nothing to console (10:59:19) Taz: so we can ship changed logging properties (10:59:31) Knut Anders Hatlen: take a look at the agent code. I think Jan St√•le wrote some code to redirect the logging (10:59:34) Taz: and if you start indexer it will just say: go to this file for logs (10:59:44) Taz: yes, that's where I wanted to look 11:00 (11:00:41) Taz: and it partly gets rid of verbose/nonverbose (11:00:51) Knut Anders Hatlen: http://src.opensolaris.org/source/xref/opengrok/trunk/src/org/opensolaris/opengrok/OpenGrokLogger.java#setConsoleLogLevel (11:00:59) Taz: the goal is that there will be almost no System.out.println (11:01:04) Taz: nor .err.println (11:01:33) Taz: the only messages will be about where is the log file and eventually help / error message if wrong option specified (11:01:38) Knut Anders Hatlen: that sounds great! (11:01:52) Taz: that's roughly the idea ... so future will be all logging (11:02:34) Knut Anders Hatlen: I like that idea, as long as we have a way to get some of it redirected to console. but it looks like setConsoleLogLevel does that for us. (11:02:45) Knut Anders Hatlen: so +1 (11:02:56) Taz: well, default java thing is to log all from INFO above (11:03:09) Taz: so INFO,WARNING and SEVERE are logged even without logging properties (11:03:16) Taz: (since the defaults from jre are taken) (11:03:38) Knut Anders Hatlen: -v could give us FINE, -vv FINER, and so on? (11:03:46) Taz: that could make sense (11:04:06) Taz: we also would ship a logging.properties, which logs all verbose stuff to log file (11:04:14) Taz: and nonverbose to console (11:04:19) Taz: and point out the log file
also logging development rules will be documented in docs
